title: minerjones
author: minerjones
content: WHAT ARE THESE?Notified by another forum member tonight who asked what these coins are....and I have no idea Both were funded January 6th, 20232013 Lealana 0.1BTC silver - FULL GILT / RED ADDRESShttps://btc.cryptoid.info/btc/address.dws?1G6U4PjSGwHtnhk4RzjtPTH9aBBZyPysXd.htm2013 Lealana 25 LTC silver - FULL GILT / RED ADDRESShttps://chainz.cryptoid.info/ltc/address.dws?LcJempWqhE2x4YZLXDj5essEoWEEo4Kkht.htm

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: OHHH WOW. Slightly suspicious. Funded in 2023 but holo not marked BF. Top coin has serial 155 but 25 litecoin also has a 155 on top of holo. I have never seen a red first bit or these coins gilted. Possibly fakes created? coins gold plated after the fact with fake holograms? Luckily the creator and expert is on the forum currently. I suspect an answer coming shortly. Cant wait to get the details.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Smoothie has been known to sell releases to only certain customers FYI. Not saying they're real but they certainly could be. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èBy that I mean when you buy them you basically sign an NDA of sorts as well. Remember the four coin monero sets? That's how those were sold as well.

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: The holograms look pretty good plus they have the new laser markings around the edge so I would lean towards legit. It would be interesting to know why the new text colour.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: These pics are from PCGS... so guessing they are legit coins

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on February 16, 2023, 03:51:00 AMSmoothie has been known to sell releases to only certain customers FYI. Not saying they're real but they certainly could be. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èBy that I mean when you buy them you basically sign an NDA of sorts as well. Remember the four coin monero sets? That's how those were sold as well.I imagine these are akin to the late-funded Casascius coins...But to have them pop up after 10 years is quite surprising.Does this mean all the coins from 2013 were not released/sold?....More so, this is serial #155 for both coins and we have seen higher serials for bothAlso, both coins have had their number/address engraved around the rim which was not a feature of the original releases in 2013

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: My complete pie-in-the-sky guess is that they're a special 10 year anniversary edition made for a VIP client to celebrate chinese new year.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Ohhh i see now the laser etching. Yes probably legit. Since they were just loaded and not marked BF. They are probably his coins. Special auction incoming???

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Lovely coins for sure....never seen them before.....where and what does Smoothie say about these? ¬† ¬†I am quite sure he can fill in the gaps on the info about these incredible looking coins!

comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on February 16, 2023, 03:51:00 AMSmoothie has been known to sell releases to only certain customers FYI. Not saying they're real but they certainly could be. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èThis I know for a fact.¬† If you have an "in" with Smoothie you at least have some ability to still pick up some older offers.¬† These new ones look pretty epic.¬† Any idea who the owner might be of these recently graded PCGS examples?

comments.body: It‚Äôs funny why Smoothie wouldn‚Äôt even comment here even though he is the maker for the coins in question..

comments.body: Quote from: Agrawas on February 19, 2023, 12:29:05 AMIt‚Äôs funny why Smoothie wouldn‚Äôt even comment here even though he is the maker for the coins in question..Personally I'm not surprised. He's a private person, and I am also wondering if someone else commissioned him to do the gilt ones. As for the pennies being on there already Yes that is kind of fucked up, but again it's none of our business really anyhow,, and now that I think about it maybe he has some deal where he hasn't even sent those in yet due to the auction time ending. Fuck who knows lol.. I give up..It's going to be an interesting auction for sure! üòÇ

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: These look crazy but good.Makes me anticipate the new silver releases and the corresponding gilt coins even more - Generally I am not too interested in fully gilt coins, but looking at these pictures may have changed my mind.On a side note: I find any "unlisted super secret cool on the side special project for special people" a bit annoying. But maybe I am just jealous.

comments.author: AT101ET
comments.body: From the image of the CoA on the listings:~LEALANA PRIVATE COLLECTIONCERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITYThis is to certify that this 2013 ONE troy ounce Lealana Physical SilverBitcoin was funded by the creator of LEALANA, Noah Luis a.k.a. ‚ÄúSmoothie‚Äù with genuine digital Bitcoin to the original Buyer and is part of Mr. Luis' private collection. The holder of this coin, untampered-security hologram, and certificate are assured or its authenticity. This coin has be loaded with the full face value by using the Bitcoin address listed below. Minted at Northwest Territorial Mint. This coin is part of a very rare RED first bits ¬†Lealana Coin 6-coin set.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on February 19, 2023, 02:58:30 PMThese look crazy but good.Makes me anticipate the new silver releases and the corresponding gilt coins even more - Generally I am not too interested in fully gilt coins, but looking at these pictures may have changed my mind.On a side note: I find any "unlisted super secret cool on the side special project for special people" a bit annoying. But maybe I am just jealous.I understand, but you also have to consider the fact that Smoothie has many "not active forum members" who buy his stuff right up, and have been for MANY years .. If you are longtime buyer, you get leads first ofc... Let's just be happy he's still making coins after 10 years!  Personally, why bother being jealous or mad? If I had been in the professional coin making business for 10 years like him, I'd certainly be doing the same - F, he probably has his own mint and hologram machine by now LOL
